details.summary: We are the main mission in the country responsible for the bilateral relations between UK and Brazil
details.description: We lead on four policy priorities.The British consulate general in São Paulo is mainly dedicated to one of the Foreign & Commonwealth Office’s essential services: supporting the British economy. The British consulate general in Rio de Janeiro is focused on the other two essential services: supporting British nationals abroad and supporting managed migration for Britain. The consular network across Brazil works in support of the activities of the three main British posts in Brazil.
details.services:
Visas

For information on whether you require a visa for the United Kingdom and how to apply go to the UK Border Agency website

Births, deaths and marriages

Information on how you can register a birth or death which occurred overseas, and legal documents for couples marrying or entering into civil partnerships abroad.

Passports and emergency travel documents

How to renew or replace your British passport when outside of the UK and information on getting replacement travel documents if your passport is lost or stolen.

Travel Advice

Information on staying safe and avoiding problems when living or travelling abroad, with links to our embassies, high commissions and other diplomatic posts across the world.

Legalisation Service

How to get official confirmation that your UK public documentation is genuine so it can be accepted by foreign authorities. The UK does not require any documents to be legalised for use within the UK.

Consular fees

Information on the current cost of fee-bearing services.

Notarial and documentary services guide for Brazil

Documents, certificates, letters and notes available from British consulates in Brazil.

details.summary: UK Trade & Investment (UKTI) helps UK-based companies succeed in the global economy. We also help overseas companies bring their high-quality investment to the UK’s dynamic economy.
details.description:
UKTI offers expertise and contacts through its extensive network of specialists in the UK, and in British embassies and other diplomatic offices around the world. We provide companies with the tools they require to be competitive on the world stage.

In Brazil, UKTI has offices at the British Embassy in Brasília, British Consulates-General in Recife, Rio de Janeiro and São Paulo and British Consulate in Porto Alegre. We also have a representative in Belo Horizonte.

Responsibilities

UKTI in Brazil helps companies in Britain increase their competitiveness through overseas trade in Brazil. We also offer professional, authoritative and personalised assistance to help companies in Brazil locate and expand in the UK.

You can find out more about how we are increasing business with Brazil.
details.services:
Start a business in the UK

UKTI offers dedicated, professional, personalised assistance to help you locate and expand your business in the UK, read about our investment services or contact us to find out more.

Export from the UK

UKTI can assist you on every step of the exporting journey in both the UK and overseas, read about our exporting services or contact us to find out more.

Events

UKTI and its partners stage events in the UK and abroad to help companies looking to export. You can browse scheduled events and register for alerts.

Business opportunities

UKTI is always looking to provide an international network of opportunities for UK Companies looking to export. You can search these opportunities and register for alerts.

details.summary: We work with the Brazilian government to help reduce poverty in other developing countries.
details.description: DFID provides no bilateral aid to Brazil. Our relationship with Brazil focuses on working together to reduce poverty and achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) in other developing countries. Brazil has excellent domestic experience in reducing poverty, hunger and inequality and is on course to achieve all the MDGs. Many developing countries are keen to learn from Brazil’s success story. We are also working with Brazil to help shape the future development agenda in international organisations such as the G20 and the United Nations.

results.title: British Consulate General Rio de Janeiro

details.summary: The British Consulate General in Rio de Janeiro works on the UK's trade and investment links with Brazil, particularly in the areas of Energy, Marine, Defence and Sports Infrastructure.
details.description: It leads on our major events cooperation with Brazil, including cooperation between the London 2012 and Rio 2016 Olympic and Paralympic Games. The Consulate also supports British nationals abroad who live in or visit Brazil and supports managed migration to Britain.

details.summary: The British Consulate-General in São Paulo is mainly dedicated to one of the Foreign & Commonwealth Office’s essential services: supporting the British economy.
details.description: UKTI supports UK based businesses to ensure their success in Brazil and encourage the best Brazilian companies to look to the UK as their global partner of choice. The Science and Innovation team engage with the local science and innovation community in support of UK policy in Brazil. The Consulate also provides consular assistance to British nationals who live or visit the Sao Paulo consular district.

details.summary: The British Consulate General in Recife represents the UK interests in the North and Northeast of Brazil.
details.description: The British Consulate-General in Recife combines all HM Government activities in the region into one office. It works to build wide-ranging and mutually beneficial relations between our two governments and peoples in the areas of trade and investment, innovation, education, culture, environment and defence. The consulate also provides consular assistance to British nationals who live or visit our area of coverage.
details.services:
Emergency travel documents

How to get an emergency travel documents if your passport is lost or stolen.

Passport Renewal

For information on how to apply for your first passport or renew an existing passport, please visit the overseas passport section

Please note that our consulate cannot deal with individual enquiries about passport applications.

Visas

For information on whether you require a visa for the United Kingdom and how to apply go to the UK Border Agency website

Please note that our consulates cannot deal with individual enquiries about visa applications. For all visa enquiries, please contact the UK Border Agency.

Notarial and documentary services

The British Consulate General in Recife has launched an online appointments booking system for notarial and documentary services. Please check the service you need on our page and book an available time slot.

Please note that notarial and documentary service customers will only be received with a pre-booked appointment.

Registering a birth or death

Information on how you can register a birth or death which occurred overseas, and legal documents for couples marrying or entering into civil partnerships abroad.

Please note that the birth and death registration service is only available at the British Consulate General in Rio de Janeiro.

Legalisation Service

How to get official confirmation that your UK public documentation is genuine so it can be accepted by foreign authorities. The UK does not require any documents to be legalised for use within the UK.

Consular fees

Information on the current cost of fee-bearing services.

Travel Advice

Information on staying safe and avoiding problems when living or travelling abroad, with links to our embassies, high commissions and other diplomatic posts across the world.

Notarial and documentary services guide for Brazil

Documents, certificates, letters and notes available from British consulates in Brazil.
